type.name: org.gradle.api.plugins.Convention
type.description: A Convention manages a set of convention objects. When you add a convention object to a Convention, and the properties and methods of the convention object become available as properties and methods of the object which the convention is associated to. A convention object is simply a POJO or POGO. Usually, a Convention is used by plugins to extend a org.gradle.api.Project or a org.gradle.api.Task.

method.name: findPlugin
method.description:
Locates the plugin convention object with the given type.
param:type The convention object type.

returns:The object. Returns null if there is no such object. @throws IllegalStateException When there are multiple matching objects.

method.name: getExtensionsAsDynamicObject
method.description:
Returns a dynamic object which represents the properties and methods contributed by the extensions and convention objects contained in this convention.

returns:The dynamic object

method.name: getPlugin
method.description:
Locates the plugin convention object with the given type.
param:type The convention object type.

returns:The object. Never returns null. @throws IllegalStateException When there is no such object contained in this convention, or when there are multiple such objects.

method.name: getPlugins
method.description:
Returns the plugin convention objects contained in this convention.

returns:The plugins. Returns an empty map when this convention does not contain any convention objects.
